Our team at CS Advising looks forward to supporting you throughout your educational career. If you have a question and can’t find the answer online, feel free to email us. Please be sure to send all communications to the emails listed below, as all appropriate staff members monitor these inboxes. On campus with a quick question? Stop by the CS Front Office (CSB 450) for our Summer QQ Hours ! Tuesday 2-3 pm, Thursdays 10-11 am. Questions about the following topics will not be addressed in QQ Hours; you must email CS Advising: Admissions, Signing CPT/OPT/RAFs, Waitlists, PhD Program, Course Recommendations, International Status Concerns Please note the Front Office will be closed for all University Holidays. For administrative, registration, and career questions, please email: Undergraduate Student Services – ug-advising@cs.columbia.edu MS & CS@CU MS  Bridge Student Services – ms-advising@cs.columbia.edu PhD Student Services – phd-advising@cs.columbia.edu Career Placement Officers – career@cs.columbia.edu Our inboxes are monitored by all staff – please start the conversation here. For academic questions, please email your CS Faculty Advisor: Undergraduate CS Faculty Advisors MS Program CS Faculty Advisors CS@CU MS Bridge Program For questions about your international status, please email ISSO . For questions about admission into CS@CU programs, please email the appropriate office: ugrad-ask@columbia.edu ms-admissions@cs.columbia.edu phd-admissions@cs.columbia.edu Want to stay in touch? Among other things, the brief asserts that “safety and security concerns can be addressed in a manner that is consistent with the values America has always stood for, including the free flow of ideas and people across borders and the welcoming of immigrants to our universities.” This recent action provides a moment for us to collectively reflect on our community within Columbia Engineering and the importance of our commitment to maintaining an open and welcoming community for all students, faculty, researchers and administrative staff. As a School of Engineering and Applied Science, we are fortunate to attract students and faculty from diverse backgrounds, from across the country, and from around the world. It is a great benefit to be able to gather engineers and scientists of so many different perspectives and talents – all with a commitment to learning, a focus on pushing the frontiers of knowledge and discovery, and with a passion for translating our work to impact humanity. I am proud of our community, and wish to take this opportunity to reinforce our collective commitment to maintaining an open and collegial environment. We are fortunate to have the privilege to learn from one another, and to study, work, and live together in such a dynamic and vibrant place as Columbia. Sincerely, Mary C.
